thread.title: Tunisia: Parliament Starts Discussion of Draft Law On Competition and Prices
thread.title_full: Tunisia: Parliament Starts Discussion of Draft Law On Competition and Prices

title: Tunisia: Parliament Starts Discussion of Draft Law On Competition and Prices
text:
Egypt: Attack On Luxor Tourist Site Referred to Military Court 
Tunis — The House of People's Representatives (HPR) began the discussion of a draft law on competition and prices at a plenary session Thursday. 
The bill, which proposes the amendment of the law currently in force (Law No. 64 of 1991 on competition and prices), was presented to the HPR by the Ministry of Trade to ensure market transparency and end parallel trade. 
The Presidency of the HPR has scheduled two plenary sessions for the discussion of the bill and its adoption, knowing that the first copy of the draft law was contested by several trades. 
The new bill proposes the amendment of 45 articles divided into five aspects concerning freedom of prices and their transparency as well as monopolistic practices and provisions related to non-liberalised products, materials and services, besides offences, contraventions and prosecution and reconciliation measures. Tunisia
